body:
Please add test.

Can this be added as an additional argument of MultiFactorScheduler?

@tdomhan 
Apologies for the delay in my response. The team is currently in discussions regarding the next release and I will update you as soon as we have a final timeline (I believe it should be sometime in October). In the meantime, is it possible for you to continue to use the master branch?

I can run the code in <https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/master/R-package/vignettes/CatsDogsFinetune.Rmd#load-pretrained-model>. I think it is the same as in <https://statist-bhfz.github.io/cats_dogs_finetune>.

As mentioned before this commit is causing the perl gpu test failure 
https://builds.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/incubator-mxnet/detail/master/435/pipeline/299

Error message is Can't load '/workspace/perl5/lib/perl5/x86_64-linux-gnu-thread-multi/auto/AI/MXNetCAPI/MXNetCAPI.so' for module AI::MXNetCAPI: libcuda.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory at /usr/lib/perl/5.18/DynaLoader.pm line 184, <DATA> line 207.
Let's not merge this before mxnet serving is finalized and ready to release. Please reopen then.
@piiswrong Can we merge now? Changes not related to CI check.

#8064 
Will fix this once merged.

inpu/output shapes need to be passed as named lists in `mx.model.init.params` : 

```
arg_params_new <- mx.model.init.params(
  symbol = new_soft, 
  input.shape = list(data = c(224, 224, 3, 8)),
  output.shape = NULL,
  initializer = mxnet:::mx.init.uniform(0.1), 
  ctx = mx.cpu()
)$arg.params
```

I changed the line for input.shape to 

      input.shape = list(data = c(224, 224, 3, 8)),

 then I am getting the error

    Error in symbol$infer.shape(list(...)) : 
      Not compatible with requested type: [type=list; target=integer].

I also tried

    input.shape = list("data" = c(224, 224, 3, 8)),

still getting the same error. 
I didn't encounter error using 

    input.shape =  c(224, 224, 3, 8),

I am using mxnet_0.10.1.

Windows or Linux? I ran the code from the pre-compiled library for Windows, version 0.10.1: 
```
cran <- getOption("repos")
cran["dmlc"] <- "https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/apache-mxnet/R/CRAN/"
options(repos = cran)
install.packages("mxnet")
```
Did you also switched output.shape to NULL?
@tqchen any idea where things could go wrong?
Thanks for finding my mistake @mikerossgithub , I have done it @piiswrong

Dear song, I'm a PHD student from Chinese Academy of Sciences and very interested in your paper-DeepCompression. My research area is similar like your paper told. So, could you please post or send my email the code resource of this paper, which is easy to understand some details. Thanks!My email is 1149077959@qq.com
Get it. Thanks a lot! @zhreshold

I have added  additional argument in MultiFactorScheduler class.
Warmup can be used when 'warmup_step' > 1.

I added a test file in test/commom/test_lr_sceduler.py.
Following is a test result
```
python test_lr_scheduler.py --lr-factor=0.1 --warmup_step=5 --lr-steps='8,10'

INFO:root:step 1 lr = 0.020000
INFO:root:step 2 lr = 0.040000
INFO:root:step 3 lr = 0.060000
INFO:root:step 4 lr = 0.080000
INFO:root:Update[5]: now learning rate arrived at 1.00000e-01, will not warm up in the future
INFO:root:step 5 lr = 0.100000
INFO:root:step 6 lr = 0.100000
INFO:root:step 7 lr = 0.100000
INFO:root:step 8 lr = 0.100000
INFO:root:Update[9]: Change learning rate to 1.00000e-02
INFO:root:step 9 lr = 0.010000
INFO:root:step 10 lr = 0.010000
INFO:root:Update[11]: Change learning rate to 1.00000e-03
INFO:root:step 11 lr = 0.001000
INFO:root:step 12 lr = 0.001000
INFO:root:step 13 lr = 0.001000
INFO:root:step 14 lr = 0.001000

``` 

@piiswrong @zhreshold

```
``Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "<ipython-input-20-b8878605d082>", line 8, in <module>
    eval_metric = mx.metric.np(Perplexity))

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\base_module.py", line 472, in fit
    self.forward_backward(data_batch)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\base_module.py", line 193, in forward_backward
    self.forward(data_batch, is_train=True)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\module.py", line 538, in forward
    self._exec_group.forward(data_batch, is_train)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\executor_group.py", line 369, in forward
    _load_data(data_batch, self.data_arrays, self.data_layouts)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\executor_group.py", line 45, in _load_data
    _load_general(batch.data, targets, major_axis)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\module\executor_group.py", line 37, in _load_general
    d_dst_copy.copyto(d_dst)

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\ndarray.py", line 819, in copyto
    return _internal._copyto(self, out=other)

  File "<string>", line 31, in _copyto

  File "D:\ProgramData\Anaconda2\lib\site-packages\mxnet-0.9.5-py2.7.egg\mxnet\base.py", line 83, in check_call
    raise MXNetError(py_str(_LIB.MXGetLastError()))

MXNetError: [11:02:43] E:\Mxnet\mxnet-0.9.5\src\ndarray\ndarray.cc:239: Check failed: from.shape() == to->shape() operands shape mismatchfrom.shape = (64,9) to.shape=(64,33)``
```
I use a BucketSentenceIter , I infer that the data_batch's bucket_length is not equal to the one which the loaded model remembered
Close it for now as we have examples in Gluon: https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/tree/master/example/gluon/word_language_model
https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/5615
Close it now. @magic282 Feel free to reopen it if you have other findings.
look like fix.closed.
I think https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/commit/37a651664854734b396a58598a0a501be5674b7e should have partially solved the problem.
Close it now because there is no discussion for a long time. @bhokaal2k Feel free to share your implementation of Guided BackPropagation.
We have gluon now and all the implementations should be shifted to gluon.
Close it now. Feel free to reopen it if the problem still occurs in the latest version.
Close it now.
Close it now and we suggest using gluon in the future.

look like is added.closed. If has some problem, reopen it.
@sxjscience
The error is on shape mismatch, but it is impossible for others to diagnose if the symbol itself is not shared.
mark https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/1810
cpu and mshadow gpu add now.

Please reopen after attaching the symbol construction logic. Just to give an idea on what's likely happening, the symbol you have has a static shape for (64, 9), but you're feeding it with (64, 33). It's probably because you didn't use BucketingModule along with BucketingSentenceIter.
Fixed now.
We've switched to gluon (http://gluon.mxnet.io/). Also, this problem has been solved in the lastest MXNet.
@asmushetzel What's the progress now for the GPU support?
Closing it for now due to inactivity. Please feel free to reopen for any follow-up discussions.
Closing it for now since we have new website design

When training, moving_mean,moving_var just compute a result. They were not used in param normalization .
When testing, if you don't want to use moving_mean and moving_var, you can set " use_global_stats = False" in batchnorm layers or set is_training=True in forward() function

This issue is closed in bulk. Feel free to reopen if this is still an active issue. Thanks!
@kevinthesun

my symbol
```
import mxnet as mx
#mx.symbol_doc.SymbolDoc.get_output_shape()
def N_gram(seq_len,batch_size,vocab_size,embed_dim,hidden_num,N):    
    data = mx.sym.Variable('data')
    embed_weight=mx.sym.Variable('embed_weight')
    H_weight=mx.sym.Variable('H_weight')
    d_bias=mx.sym.Variable('d_bias')
    U_weight=mx.sym.Variable('U_weight')
    W_weight=mx.sym.Variable('W_weight')
    b_bias=mx.sym.Variable('b_bias')
    b0_bias=mx.sym.Variable('b0_bias')
    label = mx.sym.Variable('softmax_label')
    embed = mx.sym.Embedding(data=data, input_dim=vocab_size, weight=embed_weight,output_dim=embed_dim, name='embed')
    wordvec = mx.sym.SliceChannel(data=embed,num_outputs=seq_len+N-1,squeeze_axis=1)
    y_all=[]
    for seq_idx in range(N-1,seq_len+N-1):
        word=[wordvec[i] for i in xrange(seq_idx-N+1,seq_idx+1)]
        hidden_concat = mx.sym.Concat(*word, dim=1)
        tanh_hidden=mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=hidden_concat,num_hidden=hidden_num,weight=H_weight,bias=d_bias,name='tanh_hidden')
        tanh_act=mx.sym.Activation(data=tanh_hidden, act_type="tanh")
        tanh_part=mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=tanh_act,num_hidden=vocab_size,weight=U_weight,bias=b_bias,name='tanh_part')
        fc_part=mx.sym.FullyConnected(data=hidden_concat,num_hidden=vocab_size,weight=W_weight,bias=b0_bias,name='fc_part')
        y=tanh_part+fc_part
        y_all.append(y)
    y_concat=mx.sym.Concat(*y_all,dim=0)
    label = mx.sym.transpose(data=label)
    label = mx.sym.Reshape(data=label, target_shape=(0,))
    sm = mx.sym.SoftmaxOutput(data=y_concat, label=label, name='softmax')
    return sm
```

33 is just the largest bucket_len of my data 
self.default_bucket_key+self.N-1=33

@yuruofeifei and I are working on MXNet Model serving. It's still in early stage. In current phase, it creates a http end point and allows developers to fully customize their preprocess and post process function for inference. In the future stage, more powerful functions will be added.
https://github.com/yuruofeifei/mms
